sites.name: Royal Delft - De Porceleyne Fles
sites.description: The last remaining original 17th-century Delft Blue factory. Experience the traditional production process and admire the extensive collection.
sites.booking_tips: Online booking recommended. Guided tours available.

sites.name: Nieuwe Kerk (New Church)
sites.description: Famous for its connection to the Dutch Royal Family (burial site of William of Orange and others) and its impressive tower offering panoramic views of Delft.
sites.seasonal_notes: Tower climb may have seasonal hours. Check for services.
sites.booking_tips: Combination tickets available with Oude Kerk. Tower tickets may be separate.

sites.name: Oude Kerk (Old Church)
sites.description: Delft's oldest church, known for its leaning tower and the burial site of famous painter Johannes Vermeer.
sites.booking_tips: Combination tickets available with Nieuwe Kerk.

sites.name: Vermeer Centrum Delft
sites.description: Dedicated to the life and work of Johannes Vermeer, offering insights into his techniques and the Delft of his time, although it doesn't house original paintings.

sites.name: Museum Prinsenhof Delft
sites.description: Housed in a former convent, this museum details the history of the Dutch Republic and the life of William of Orange, who was assassinated here.

sites.name: Delft City Hall (Stadhuis)
sites.description: A beautiful Renaissance-style building on the Markt square, opposite the Nieuwe Kerk. While primarily administrative, its architecture is a key sight.
sites.seasonal_notes: Market days (Thursday/Saturday) offer a lively atmosphere.
sites.booking_tips: Not typically open for tours, view from Markt square.

sites.name: TU Delft Botanic Garden
sites.description: Part of the Delft University of Technology, this garden features a diverse collection of plants, trees, and greenhouses.
sites.seasonal_notes: Best during flowering seasons. Check opening hours.
sites.booking_tips: Located slightly outside the main center.

sites.name: Delft Canals
sites.description: Explore the charming canals of Delft by foot, bike, or boat tour. Offers picturesque views of historic buildings and bridges.

neighborhoods.name: Delft Binnenstad
neighborhoods.character: Picturesque historic city center dominated by canals, monumental buildings, the Markt square, and a charming, walkable atmosphere.

location.description: The historic core of Delft, encompassing the area within the old city canals, centered around the Markt square.

history.overview: Flourished in the Dutch Golden Age (17th century) as a center for trade, art (Vermeer), science (Van Leeuwenhoek), and Delft Blue pottery. Much of the historic architecture remains.
history.significance: One of the best-preserved historic city centers in the Netherlands, reflecting its Golden Age prosperity and cultural importance.
notable_events: Residence of William of Orange (16th century)
Life and work of Johannes Vermeer (17th century)

practical_info.safety: Very safe, pleasant atmosphere day and night. Cobblestones can be uneven.
practical_info.best_time_to_visit: Anytime, but spring/summer offers best weather for canals and terraces. Market days (Thurs/Sat) are lively.
practical_info.walkability: Extremely walkable, best explored on foot. Boat tours offer a different perspective.

attractions.name: Markt Square
attractions.description: One of the largest historic market squares in Europe, flanked by the Nieuwe Kerk and City Hall.
attractions.appeal: Iconic Delft view, lively market, numerous cafes with terraces.

attractions.name: Nieuwe Kerk & Oude Kerk
attractions.description: Two major historic churches, linked to the Dutch Royal Family and Vermeer respectively.
attractions.appeal: Climb the Nieuwe Kerk tower for views, see Vermeer's burial place in Oude Kerk.

attractions.name: Museum Prinsenhof Delft
attractions.description: Museum detailing the history of William of Orange and the Dutch Republic.
attractions.appeal: Learn about a key figure in Dutch history in the location of his assassination.

activities.name: Canal Boat Tour
activities.description: Guided boat tour through the historic canals.

activities.name: Shopping (Antiques & Delft Blue)
activities.description: Browse the numerous shops selling Delft Blue pottery, antiques, and local crafts.

activities.name: Walking Tour (Vermeer/History)
activities.description: Explore the city on foot, focusing on sites related to Vermeer or Delft's history.

stay_here_if: You want to be immersed in Delft's historic charm.
You enjoy easy access to museums, shops, and restaurants.
avoid_if: You are traveling by car and need easy parking.
You prefer modern accommodations (though some exist).
You are looking for large green parks within walking distance.
insider_tips: Explore the quieter side canals away from the Markt for hidden gems.
Visit the Beestenmarkt square for a lively evening atmosphere with many terraces.
Look for the 'hofjes' (hidden inner courtyards) for a glimpse into historical communal living.

neighborhoods.name: TU Delft Campus
neighborhoods.character: Modern, sprawling university campus known for its innovative architecture, research facilities, and student life. Features parks and green spaces.

location.description: Located south/southeast of the historic city center, a large dedicated area for the Delft University of Technology.

history.overview: Established in 1842 as a Royal Academy, evolved into a leading international university of technology. The campus has expanded significantly, particularly post-WWII, featuring notable modern architecture.
history.significance: Major center for technological innovation and education in the Netherlands and Europe. Drives much of Delft's modern economy and character.
notable_events: Construction of iconic modern buildings (Library, Aula)
Continued growth as international research hub

transit: Well-served by buses from Delft Station
Approx. 10-15 min cycle from city center
practical_info.safety: Very safe campus environment, well-lit and patrolled.
practical_info.best_time_to_visit: Weekdays during academic year to see campus life. Architectural tours often available.
practical_info.walkability: Walkable within specific areas, but the campus is large; cycling is very common and recommended for exploring.

attractions.name: TU Delft Library
attractions.description: Iconic library building with a sloping grass roof and a large cone piercing through it.
attractions.appeal: Must-see example of modern Dutch architecture, climb the grass roof.

attractions.name: Aula Conference Centre
attractions.description: Distinctive brutalist building designed by Van den Broek en Bakema.
attractions.appeal: Key example of post-war Dutch architecture, often hosts events.

attractions.name: TU Delft Botanic Garden
attractions.description: University botanical garden with diverse plant collections and greenhouses.
attractions.appeal: Peaceful green space, interesting plant species.

dining.name: Food Trucks (occasional)
dining.atmosphere: Temporary food vendors during campus events.

activities.name: Architectural Tour
activities.description: Self-guided or guided tour focusing on the unique modern architecture of the campus buildings.

activities.name: Cycling the Campus
activities.description: Explore the extensive campus grounds and green spaces by bicycle.

stay_here_if: You are visiting the university for academic purposes.
You are interested in modern architecture and green campus environments.
You find affordable accommodation options targeting students.
avoid_if: You want the charm and atmosphere of the historic city center.
You want a wide variety of dining and nightlife options.
You prefer not to rely on cycling or buses to get around.
insider_tips: The TU Delft Library roof is a popular spot for students to relax on sunny days.
Check the university's event calendar for public lectures, exhibitions, or performances.
Many faculty buildings have interesting interior spaces accessible to the public during opening hours.

fine_dining.name: Restaurant Van der Dussen
fine_dining.atmosphere: Elegant dining in a historic canal house
fine_dining.booking_tips: Book several weeks in advance, especially for weekends; request canal view table.
fine_dining.local_tips: Known for its beautiful courtyard garden for summer dining and classic ambiance.

fine_dining.name: Le Vieux Jean
fine_dining.atmosphere: Traditional French bistro style, intimate setting
fine_dining.booking_tips: Reservations highly recommended due to small size.
fine_dining.local_tips: A long-standing Delft establishment known for classic French dishes and wine list.

casual_dining.name: Kobus Kuch
casual_dining.atmosphere: Trendy, bustling, popular with locals and students
casual_dining.booking_tips: Can get very busy, especially weekends; go early or expect a wait.
casual_dining.local_tips: Renowned for its apple pie, often cited as the best in Delft.

casual_dining.name: Spijshuis de Dis
casual_dining.booking_tips: Book ahead, popular for its authentic Dutch food experience.
casual_dining.local_tips: Offers a genuine taste of old-fashioned Dutch home cooking.

casual_dining.name: THUIS by Ladera
casual_dining.booking_tips: Good spot for shared dining and cocktails.
casual_dining.local_tips: Focuses on shared dining concepts with international flavors.

street_food.name: Delft Market (Thursday/Saturday)
street_food.local_tips: Thursday market is larger; try fresh herring 'Hollandse Nieuwe' (seasonal, May/June) or warm stroopwafels.

street_food.name: Leo's Koffiehuis (Frites)
street_food.local_tips: Classic Dutch fast food experience, try 'patatje oorlog' (fries with mayo, satay sauce, onions).

coffee_shops.name: Kobus Kuch
coffee_shops.local_tips: Known city-wide for its apple pie. Expect queues during peak times.

coffee_shops.name: KEEK
coffee_shops.local_tips: Focuses on organic and local products, popular lunch spot.

coffee_shops.name: Coffee Company
coffee_shops.atmosphere: Standard coffee chain, good for working/studying
coffee_shops.local_tips: Multiple locations, consistent quality, popular with students.

bars.name: Bierhuis de Klomp
bars.specialty: Large selection of Dutch & Belgian Beers
bars.atmosphere: Oldest pub in Delft (est. 1652), traditional, cozy
bars.local_tips: Authentic 'brown cafe' experience, knowledgeable staff about beers.

bars.name: Locus Publicus
bars.atmosphere: Classic pub feel, popular with beer enthusiasts
bars.local_tips: Over 200 beers on the menu, great place to explore different styles.

bars.name: De Gist
bars.local_tips: Focuses on modern craft beer trends, often has brewery tap takeovers.

bars.name: Beestenmarkt Square
bars.atmosphere: Lively square lined with cafes/bars with large terraces
bars.local_tips: Great spot for people-watching and enjoying drinks outdoors in summer under the plane trees.

food_tours.name: Delft Culinary Walking Tour
food_tours.booking_tips: Check local tour operators, good way to combine sightseeing and tasting.

cooking_classes.name: Dutch Baking Workshop (e.g., Apple Pie)
cooking_classes.booking_tips: Look for workshops offered by local cooking studios or community centers.

markets.name: Thursday Market
highlights: Fresh produce, cheese, fish, bread, clothing, flowers
markets.location: Markt Square and surrounding streets (Brabantse Turfmarkt, Burgwal)
markets.local_tips: The main market day in Delft, very lively.

markets.name: Saturday Market
highlights: Focus on food (cheese, nuts, olives, bread) and flowers
markets.location: Brabantse Turfmarkt & Burgwal (not on Markt square)
markets.local_tips: More focused on food items than the larger Thursday market.

markets.name: Summer Antiques & Bric-a-Brac Market
markets.location: Along the canals in the Hippolytusbuurt area
markets.local_tips: Fun for browsing even if not buying, combines well with a canal walk.

spring: White Asparagus ('het witte goud') served traditionally (Late April - June)
'Hollandse Nieuwe' Herring (Raw herring, starting late May/June)
autumn: 'Stamppot' (mashed potatoes with vegetables like kale 'boerenkool' or endive 'andijvie')
winter: 'Oliebollen' & 'Appelbeignets' (doughnuts & apple fritters, especially around New Year)

destinations.whyGo: Experience the Netherlands' vibrant capital with its iconic canals, world-class museums, and distinctive architecture.
Discover the Netherlands' second-largest city known for its modern architecture, innovative design, and bustling harbor.
Visit the seat of Dutch government, international courts, royal palaces, and beautiful North Sea beaches.
Explore this historic city with its iconic Dom Tower, charming canals, and rich cultural heritage.
Visit the historic university city, birthplace of Rembrandt, with charming canals and numerous museums.
Famous for its cheese market (seasonal), historic city hall, and beautiful stained-glass windows in St. Janskerk.
Explore the 'City of Light', known for its design heritage (Philips, Dutch Design Week) and technology focus.
Explore the EU capital with its magnificent Grand Place, Art Nouveau architecture, and renowned chocolate and beer.
Visit Belgium's second city known for its diamond trade, fashion scene, and magnificent cathedral and train station.
Explore one of the world's most dynamic cities with its historic landmarks, cultural diversity, and cutting-edge arts scene.
Experience the iconic City of Light with its world-famous landmarks, unparalleled museums, and legendary culinary scene.
Discover Germany's dynamic capital with its turbulent history, cutting-edge arts scene, and legendary nightlife.

activities.name: King's Day (Koningsdag)
activities.description: Join the nationwide celebration! Delft fills with orange outfits, street parties, flea markets ('vrijmarkt'), and music, especially around the Markt and Beestenmarkt.
activities.seasonal_notes: Celebrated annually on April 27th (or 26th if 27th is a Sunday). Expect crowds and a festive atmosphere.
activities.booking_tips: No booking needed for street events. Wear orange! Public transport may run on a modified schedule.

activities.name: Canal Boat Tours Season Opening
activities.description: Enjoy a relaxing boat tour through Delft's historic canals as the season reopens, offering unique views of the city's architecture.
activities.seasonal_notes: Boat tours typically resume in March or April. Check operator websites for exact dates and schedules.
activities.booking_tips: Book online or at the departure points. Weekends can be busy, especially with good weather.

activities.name: Keukenhof Gardens Day Trip
activities.description: Visit the world-famous Keukenhof Gardens (near Lisse) to see millions of tulips and spring flowers in bloom. Easily accessible from Delft.
activities.seasonal_notes: Open mid-March to mid-May. Peak bloom varies but is often mid-April.
activities.booking_tips: Book transport (e.g., bus from Leiden/Schiphol) and entry tickets well in advance, especially during peak season and holidays.

activities.name: Terrace Season Opening
activities.description: Experience the Dutch 'terrasjes' culture as cafes and bars open their outdoor seating areas. Enjoy drinks and snacks by the canals or on squares like Beestenmarkt.
activities.seasonal_notes: Terraces open as weather permits, usually becoming consistently popular from April onwards.
activities.booking_tips: Popular spots fill up quickly on sunny days. No reservations usually needed for casual drinks.

activities.name: Delft Flower Market
activities.description: Browse vibrant spring flowers, plants, and bulbs at the weekly markets (especially Saturday market on Brabantse Turfmarkt/Burgwal).
activities.seasonal_notes: Spring brings the best selection of tulips and other seasonal flowers.
activities.booking_tips: Arrive early for the best choice. Bring cash, although some vendors accept cards.

activities.name: Oude Delft Antiques & Curiosities Market
activities.description: Stroll along the canals (Hippolytusbuurt area) browsing antiques, books, art, and collectibles at this charming summer market.
activities.seasonal_notes: Runs weekly on Saturdays from April to October. Very picturesque setting.
activities.booking_tips: Popular event, can get crowded. Good for unique finds and atmosphere.

activities.name: Delft Chamber Music Festival
activities.description: Enjoy high-quality classical chamber music performances in beautiful historic venues like the Van der Mandelezaal (Prinsenhof).
activities.seasonal_notes: Usually held late July / early August. Features international artists.
activities.booking_tips: Book tickets well in advance via the festival website, popular concerts sell out.

activities.name: Outdoor Dining & Drinks (Terraces)
activities.description: Peak season for enjoying Delft's many canal-side and square terraces (Markt, Beestenmarkt). Relax with drinks or a meal outdoors.
activities.seasonal_notes: Long summer evenings make terrace hopping popular. Beestenmarkt is particularly lively.
activities.booking_tips: Reservations recommended for dinner, especially on popular terraces.

activities.name: Day Trip to Scheveningen Beach
activities.description: Take the tram (Line 1) directly from Delft to The Hague's famous beach resort, Scheveningen, for sunbathing, swimming, beach bars, and the pier.
activities.seasonal_notes: Best on warm, sunny days. Can be very busy during heatwaves.
activities.booking_tips: Buy a day ticket for the tram. Allow ample travel time on peak days.

activities.name: Explore Delftse Hout
activities.description: Visit the large recreational park just outside the city center for walking, cycling, swimming (in the lake), and picnicking.
activities.seasonal_notes: Popular local spot for outdoor activities in summer.
activities.booking_tips: Easily reachable by bike. Check water quality notices before swimming.

activities.name: Cultural Season Opening
activities.description: Theatres (e.g., Theater de Veste) and music venues launch their new season programs with diverse performances.
activities.seasonal_notes: September marks the start of the main cultural season.
activities.booking_tips: Check venue websites for programs and book tickets in advance for popular shows.

activities.name: Bokbier Season
activities.description: Sample seasonal 'Herfstbok' (autumn bock beer) in Delft's traditional pubs and specialty beer bars like De Klomp or Locus Publicus.
activities.seasonal_notes: Bokbier becomes widely available from late September/October. Many bars have special Bokbier events.
activities.booking_tips: Ask bartenders for recommendations. Some bars offer tasting flights.

activities.name: Cozy Pub Visits ('Bruin Cafés')
activities.description: Enjoy the warm, traditional atmosphere of Delft's 'brown cafes' (historic pubs) on cooler autumn evenings.
activities.seasonal_notes: Perfect time to experience the cozy 'gezelligheid' of Dutch pubs.
activities.booking_tips: Generally no reservations needed for drinks. Try local snacks ('borrelhapjes').

activities.name: Museum Visits
activities.description: Explore Delft's museums like the Prinsenhof, Vermeer Centrum, or Royal Delft factory on cooler or rainy autumn days.
activities.seasonal_notes: Museums are often less crowded than in peak summer season.
activities.booking_tips: Check opening hours. Online booking can sometimes offer discounts or skip lines.

activities.name: TU Delft Campus Exploration
activities.description: Explore the university campus with its striking modern architecture as the academic year gets underway.
activities.seasonal_notes: Campus is active with students and researchers. Autumn foliage adds color.
activities.booking_tips: Take a walk or cycle around. Check for any public lectures or events.

activities.name: Lichtjesavond (Light Evening)
activities.description: Delft's beloved winter event where thousands of lights illuminate the city center, Christmas trees are lit, and there's music, market stalls, and festive cheer.
activities.seasonal_notes: A major highlight of Delft's winter calendar. Expect very large crowds.
activities.booking_tips: Arrive early. Use public transport as city center access is restricted. Dress warmly.

activities.name: Sinterklaas Arrival (Intocht)
activities.description: Experience the Dutch tradition as Sinterklaas (St. Nicholas) arrives in Delft by boat, followed by a parade through the city.
activities.seasonal_notes: A festive event, especially for children, marking the start of the Sinterklaas season leading up to Dec 5th.
activities.booking_tips: Check the official route and timings. Arrive early for a good viewing spot along the canals or parade route.

activities.name: Christmas Markets & Shopping
activities.description: Browse festive stalls selling gifts, food, and glühwein (mulled wine) at smaller Christmas markets and enjoy holiday shopping in the decorated city center.
activities.seasonal_notes: Markets often pop up on specific weekends. Shops have extended hours leading up to Christmas.
activities.booking_tips: Check local listings for specific market dates and locations.

activities.name: Ice Skating (Potential)
activities.description: Sometimes a temporary ice skating rink is set up, often on the Markt square or near the station, during the winter months.
activities.seasonal_notes: Availability varies year to year; check local announcements closer to winter.
activities.booking_tips: If available, skate rental is usually offered onsite.

activities.name: Oliebollen & Winter Treats
activities.description: Sample traditional Dutch winter treats like 'oliebollen' (doughnuts) and 'appelflappen' (apple fritters) from street stalls, especially around New Year.
activities.seasonal_notes: Oliebollen stalls ('oliebollenkramen') appear throughout the city in late autumn/winter.
activities.booking_tips: Look for stalls near shopping areas or markets. Best enjoyed warm!

ranges.notes: Public holiday, most businesses closed. Quiet, potentially cold. Good for cozy cafes and museum visits.
Winter sales. Cold, crisp weather possible. Fewer tourists, ideal for exploring museums (Prinsenhof, Vermeer Centrum, Royal Delft) without crowds.
Cold winter weather continues, potentially damp. Low season for tourism, great for indoor attractions.
Some restaurants offer special menus. Cozy atmosphere in historic pubs.
End of winter, maybe occasional brighter days. Still quiet tourist-wise.
Early spring, weather unpredictable but improving. Canal tours may start operating. First hints of terrace life on sunny days.
World-famous flower gardens open nearby. Start planning day trips. Delft flower market gets more vibrant.
Ideal time for Keukenhof day trip. Easter weekend brings events & crowds. Spring flowers bloom in Delft.
Pleasant spring weather likely. Canal tours running regularly. Terraces bustling on sunny days.
Major national holiday. City packed with orange-clad crowds, street markets, music. Very festive atmosphere.
Excellent spring conditions. Good time for cycling trips around Delft.
Generally beautiful spring weather. Last chance for Keukenhof.
Potential local events/concerts (public holiday status varies).
Usually excellent weather. Perfect for walking tours, canal boats, cycling, terraces. Tourism levels high.
Start of summer. Long daylight hours. Ideal for outdoor activities, Oude Delft Antiques Market (Saturdays), exploring Delftse Hout park. Day trips to Scheveningen beach.

ranges.event: Peak Summer / Delft Chamber Music Festival (late July/early Aug)
ranges.notes: Warmest month, potentially hot. Peak tourist season. Terraces are very popular. Book accommodation and popular tours well in advance. Check dates for Chamber Music Festival.

ranges.event: Peak Summer / Delft Chamber Music Festival (early Aug)
ranges.notes: Continued peak season. Warm weather ideal for outdoor activities. Oude Delft market continues. High tourism levels.
Late summer, often still pleasant weather. Tourism starts to decrease slightly after summer holidays end. Good time for exploring.

ranges.event: Start of Cultural Season / Bokbier Season
ranges.notes: Weather becomes more autumnal. Theaters start new season. First autumn bock beers appear in pubs.
Autumn colors appear. Cooler, potentially rainy weather. Last month for Oude Delft market. Good time for museums and cozy pubs. Bokbier widely available.
Low season. Weather often grey, damp, and cool. Focus on indoor activities: museums, cafes, pubs.
Children's lantern processions mainly in residential areas in the evening.
Sinterklaas arrives by boat, big parade. Festive atmosphere starts building. Check exact date.
Lead up to Sinterklaas gift-giving evening (Dec 5th). Shops are busy.
Sinterklaas season continues. Shops very busy.
Main Dutch gift-giving evening, primarily a family celebration at home.
Christmas lights and decorations appear. Festive atmosphere builds.
Major Delft event! City center lit by candles/lights, tree lighting, market stalls. Very crowded but magical. Usually one Tuesday evening mid-Dec.
Christmas shopping period. Potential smaller Christmas markets. Oliebollen stalls appear.
Shops close early. Quiet evening.
Public holidays. Most businesses, including museums, closed. Very quiet.
Between Christmas and New Year. Some shops/museums open, some closed. Check ahead.
Shops close early. Fireworks (private use can be extensive). Some restaurants/bars have special events (booking essential).

scoreDescription.1: Poor: Unfavorable conditions, extreme weather, overcrowded or very limited activities
scoreDescription.2: Below Average: Less ideal conditions, possibly unpleasant weather or very low/high tourism (business closures)
scoreDescription.3: Average: Standard conditions, typical weather, moderate tourism, potential for specific event crowds
scoreDescription.4: Good: Very favorable conditions, pleasant weather, manageable crowds
scoreDescription.5: Excellent: Perfect conditions, special events, ideal weather, moderate crowds
